derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: figurative use of Mogul
1960s: probably from southern German dialect Mugel, Mugl

entry.tran: 莫卧儿人(16至18世纪印度的穆斯林统治者)
entry.def: A Mogul was  a Muslim ruler in India in the sixteenth to eighteenth centuries.

entry.tran: (尤指新闻、影视业的)有权势的富商，大人物，大亨
entry.def: A mogul is an important, rich, and powerful businessman, especially one in the news, film, or television industry.

means.word_mean: 1. a bump on a ski slope
2. a very wealthy or powerful businessman;
